column5: I recollect that the best year ever for Northern Lights was in '91; we were on the 51st parallel. I also understand that the intensity of the Aurora is on a 10 to 11 year cycle. How have the northern lights been this year up north?
Last August, 60 miles north of Red Lake was the first time I have seen them since I was a kid. Humbling. Pooch in central Illinois

91 was great! We were at LOW in June. The lights covered the sky from horizon to horizon. This year should be a banner year. A couple of months ago the lights were seen as far south as Salt Lake City when a coronal mass ejection hit the earth almost dead center. That blast killed one comm. sat.
Hi, I'll be at Red Lake in a couplke weeks. Will I have a chance to see them? Do I need need to take a drive north to see them? This sounds really neat...appreciate any info you can give...thanks!!
If they are cooking you will see them from Red Lake. Have seen them many times from the Red Lake - Ear Falls area. (see them once in a while from so. mn also) cw
The following url is a good site to check for forecasting aurora activity http://www.gi.alaska.edu/aurora_predict/worldmap2.htmlThe sure are messmerizing when you see them.
One for the road .... url that is http://sec.noaa.gov/pmap/index.html
